record.author: Lindström field notes
record.notes: non-Austronesian ("East Papuan"), New Ireland, Papua New Guinea. Previous names: Panaras (also Nayama, Kun, Kulot; see Lindström 2002 p19). Noun endings -ma, -na, -nəm, -nim, -bam, -bu, -bun, -uom disappear in plural formation and should probably be ignored for comparative purposes.

record.annotation: chew and swallow juice, as of sugar cane
Vcls 2, make 'mumu', cook in stones (iouna=cooking stones)
same in Nalik, Nochi, Madak ('my mother')
older root? base of collective forms
shoot or stab with spear etc.

Vcls 1, hit with stick, also 'cut firewood'

Vcls 1 'split bamboo, or areca palm trunk for walling or flooring'
Vcls 1 'split firewood, or vine for lashing'

'what you have with the carbo hydrates (Tok Pisin abus)'
of dog as well as snake
also 'lower back of pig (butchered with the tail)'
tail and backmost part of fish
the blue sky, clouds are below it
mist, rising from forest after rain
Vcls 1, dry, be dry in general
Vcls 1, of sores or anything wet that dries out
Vcls 3 'burn secondary growth in garden preparation'
also 'low tide, reef at low tide'
many many forms,+ inflected for person
many many forms,+ inflected for person
